ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
- 3.11.* *_cpython
- 3.12.* *_cpython
- 3.13.* *_cp313
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and
experiments.

name: mcxtrace-suite

about.description:
McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and
experiments.
about.summary: McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and experiments.

about.description:
McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and
experiments.
about.summary: McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and experiments.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "3.6.4" %}

package:
  name: mcxtrace-suite
  version: {{ version }}

# sha256 value manually found by
# curl -sL url | openssl sha256
source:
  url: https://github.com/mccode-dev/McCode/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f51a3c35d88a7f7841a4b43254992263ad653fe8b1461357efd1f84323ed5c22
  folder: src

build:
  number: 0

outputs:

  - name: mcxtrace-core
    script: install-files-core.sh  # [unix]
    script: install-files-core.bat  # [win]
    requirements:
      build:
        - cmake
        - make  # [unix]
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - flex  # [unix]
        - bison  # [unix]
        - winflexbison  # [win]
      host:
        - dirent  # [win]
      run:
        - python
        - c-compiler
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - bash  # [unix]
        # for mxrun
        - pyaml
        - numpy
        - mslex  # [win]
    test:
      files:
        - test_pkg.py
      commands:
        - python test_pkg.py core
      source_files:
        - src/mcxtrace-comps/examples/ESRF/ESRF_BM29/ESRF_BM29.instr
        - src/mcxtrace-comps/examples/AstroX_ESA/NuSTAR_1shell_con/NuSTAR_1shell_con.instr

  - name: mcxtrace-data
    build:
      noarch: generic
    script: install-files-data.sh  # [unix]
    script: install-files-data.bat  # [win]
    test:
      files:
        - test_pkg.py
      requires:
        - python
      commands:
        - python test_pkg.py data

  - name: mcxtrace-mxgui
    requirements:
      run:
        - mcxtrace-core
        - pyqt
        - qscintilla2
    test:
      files:
        - test_pkg.py
      commands:
        - python test_pkg.py mxgui

  - name: mcxtrace-vis
    requirements:
      run:
        - mcxtrace-core
        #  Note: conda-forge linter wants matplotlib-base and not matplotlib. It
        #  actually makes no difference (as per October 2023) since we anyway
        #  install tornado+pyqt.
        - matplotlib-base
        - numpy
        - tornado >=5
        - scipy
        - pillow
        - pyqtgraph
        - pyqt >=5.10
        - qtpy
        - nodejs
        # for traces from mxdisplay
        - ply
        # for sync of 3D / js files
        - rsync  # [unix]
        # for visualisation of test output
        - jinja2
        # for creating CAD output from mxdisplay
        - cadquery  # [not ppc64le]
        # McStasscript and jupyter support
        - mcstasscript
        - jupytext
        - jupyterlab
        - m2-which  # [win]
        - m2-sed  # [win]
        - m2-grep  # [win]
        - m2-gzip  # [win]
        - m2-coreutils  # [win]

    test:
      files:
        - test_pkg.py
      commands:
        - python test_pkg.py vis

  - name: mcxtrace
    test:
      files:
        - test_pkg.py
      requires:
      commands:
        - python test_pkg.py mcxtrace
    requirements:
      run:
        - {{ pin_subpackage('mcxtrace-core', max_pin="x.x.x") }}
        - {{ pin_subpackage('mcxtrace-data', max_pin="x.x.x") }}
        - {{ pin_subpackage('mcxtrace-mxgui', max_pin="x.x.x") }}
        - {{ pin_subpackage('mcxtrace-vis', max_pin="x.x.x") }}
        - msmpi  # [win]
        - openmpi =4  # [unix]
        - ucx  # [linux]
        - gsl
        - libnexus
        - nexpy
        - cif2hkl
        - mcpl >=2.2.0  # [not ppc64le]
        - mcpl-core >=2.2.0  # [not ppc64le]
        - mcpl-extra >=2.2.0  # [not ppc64le]
        - xraylib

about:
  home: https://mcxtrace.org/
  summary: McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and experiments.
  description: |
    McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and
    experiments.
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: src/COPYING
  doc_url: https://mcxtrace.org/
  dev_url: https://github.com/mccode-dev/McCode

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - willend
    - tkittel
    - ebknudsen

about.description:
McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and
experiments.
about.summary: McXtrace is a general tool for simulating x-ray scattering instruments and experiments.
